questions.title: Item Questionnaire
questions.question: What material is your item mainly made of?
questions.subtitle: Choose the closest option

questions.question: Is the item clean and dry?
questions.subtitle: Residue can contaminate recycling

questions.question: Does this item contain any battery or electronics?
questions.subtitle: If yes, use e-waste collection

questions.question: Is it mostly one material?
questions.subtitle: Mixed-material items are harder to recycle

outcomes.explanation: This item is likely suitable for blue-bin recycling when clean and dry.
tips: Empty the item and rinse off residue.
Place clean recyclable parts in the blue recycling bin.
outcomes.instruction: Clean and dry the item, then place it in the blue recycling bin.

outcomes.explanation: Items with food or liquid residue should not go directly into recycling streams.
tips: If possible, rinse and dry before recycling.
If not cleanable, dispose as general waste.
Do not put heavily soiled items in the blue recycling bin.
outcomes.instruction: If the item cannot be cleaned, dispose it as general waste.

outcomes.explanation: Electronic items should be recycled through dedicated e-waste collection channels.
tips: Do not place electronics into the blue recycling bin.
Bring the item to an e-waste collection point.
outcomes.instruction: Use an official e-waste collection point for this item.

outcomes.explanation: Lighting products should be recycled through the dedicated lighting stream.
tips: Do not put bulbs or lamps in the blue recycling bin.
Wrap broken bulbs carefully to prevent injury.
outcomes.instruction: Send this item to a lighting collection point.

outcomes.explanation: Textiles should go to textile donation or textile recycling channels.
tips: Keep textile items clean and dry.
Use textile collection or donation channels.
outcomes.instruction: Use textile donation or textile collection channels for this item.

outcomes.explanation: The answers are not enough for a confident decision.
tips: Avoid placing uncertain items in the blue recycling bin.
Use the AI Trash Scan for a second opinion.
If still unsure, follow local disposal guidance.
outcomes.instruction: Try AI Trash Scan for a more precise result.
